WIDGET_DESCRIPTION.STATUS_PIE: Display the latest execution status with the given product lane in a pie chart.
WIDGET_DESCRIPTION.STATUS_PIE_ADVANCE: Display the latest execution status with the given product lane in a pie chart with a legend.
WIDGET_DESCRIPTION.INVESTIGATED_TEST_STATUS_PIE: Display the latest execution investigated status with the given product lane in a pie chart
WIDGET_DESCRIPTION.PASSRATE_LINE: Display the pass rate of x number of executions with the given product lane in a line chart. The number of execution can be selected from the Range option. The default number is 20 executions.
WIDGET_DESCRIPTION.MPL_PASSRATE_LINE: Display multiple pass rates of x number of executions with the given product lanes in a line chart. The number of execution can be selected from the Range option. The default number is 20 executions.
WIDGET_DESCRIPTION.RELATIONS_GROUP_BY_BAR: Display the group by the status of test relations from the lastest execution with the given product lane in a bar chart. To make test relation available, the selected product lane needs to have product lane settings set up.
WIDGET_DESCRIPTION.BUILD_HISTORY_BAR: Display test status of x number of executions with the given product lane in a bar chart. The number of execution can be selected from the Range option. The default number is 20 executions.
WIDGET_DESCRIPTION.MOSTFAILREASON_TABLE: A table displays the fail reasons of all non-pass test cases in the latest execution of given product lane
WIDGET_DESCRIPTION.UNSTABLE_TESTS_TABLE: A table displays the unstable tests and their status trend of x executions with the given product lane. The number of execution can be selected from the Range option. The default number is 20 executions. The high failure rate shows any tests that have more than a 10% failure rate which helps you to quickly identify the unstable tests. The low fail rate shows any test has less than a 10% failure rate which helps you to identify intermittent issues that occur less frequently leading the test to fail.
WIDGET_DESCRIPTION.STABLE_TESTS_TABLE: A table displays the tests, which have a stable status trend of x executions with the given product lane. The number of execution can be selected from the Range option. The default number is 20 executions. There are three trends: Always pass, Always fail and Always skip.
WIDGET_DESCRIPTION.MPL_BUILD_TABLE: A table displays one or more product lane's latest execution results. If the dashboard has a default product lane, it will always show the default product lane. Other product lanes could be selected separately. If a pattern product lane is given, all matched product lanes will display in the table. (Only executions within 90 days will be considered)
WIDGET_DESCRIPTION.BUILD_CALENDAR: Display builds with the given product lanes in the calendar.
WIDGET_DESCRIPTION.HEATMAP_TEST_RELATION: Display the group by the status of test relations from x number of executions in a heat map. The number of execution can be selected from the Range option. The default number is 20 executions.
WIDGET_DESCRIPTION.TREEMAP_TEST_RELATION: Display the appearance of test relations from x number of executions in a treemap. The number of execution can be selected from the Range option. The default number is 20 executions.
WIDGET_DESCRIPTION.STATUS_SUMMARY_CARD: Display a collection of cards summarized the status of tests from x executions with the given product lane. A recurring time period can be defined with the custom range that makes it a perfect widget for Sprint, quarterly, or yearly dashboards.
WIDGET_DESCRIPTION.BUILD_SUMMARY_CARD: Display a collection of cards summarized the status of builds from x executions with the given product lane. A recurring time period can be defined with the custom range that makes it a perfect widget for Sprint, quarterly, or yearly dashboards.
WIDGET_DESCRIPTION.INVESTIGATED_SUMMARY_CARD: Display a collection of cards summarized the status of investigated tests from x executions with the given product lane. A recurring time period can be defined with the custom range that makes it a perfect widget for Sprint, quarterly, or yearly dashboards.

BUTTON_GROUP_STATUS.TT_RERUN: Rerun (rerun number is not calucalted in the total number of tests executed)
BUTTON_GROUP_STATUS.TT_UNRESOLVED_INVESTIGATED: Unresolved investigated tests from all past run
BUTTON_GROUP_STATUS.TT_NEW_TESTS: New tests appeared in recent run

FAQ.ANSWER_API_LBL: Please refer to our REST API documentation for more information.
FAQ.ANSWER_PL_1:
A product lane represents a conceptual combination of 8 pre-defined fields by UReport. Among these 8 fields, 2 are mandatory, and the other 6 are optional.
Let's use an example to explain it.
Say we have a web application that runs automation regression nightly. We need to run it in three different browsers. (Chrome, Firefox, and Safari).
We could have 3 potential product lanes in this scenario.
FAQ.ANSWER_PL_2:
All fields are free text, you can provide any suitable text for your organization. To make distinctions between each build, a build number must be provided through the payload
Once these product lanes are set, all future executions should keep pushing results under the same product lane with different build numbers from your CI software.
To know how to send data to the UReport server.
FAQ.ANSWER_AUTOANALYZE_1:
Auto analysis is one of the key feature UReport offers. User does not need to setup anything. it is on by default and cannot be turn off.
When user mark a fail test as an issue, if the marked test case failed in the future for the same reason, UReport will automatically mark the test as Investigated and indicate with the symbol .
UReport will search back, by default, 30 days for all investigated issues within the same Product and Automation Type.
This day number can be changed in the Settings.

How does it work?
When save failed test case through API, there are three fields user can provide:
FAQ.ANSWER_AUTOANALYZE_2:
To allow the auto analysis to work. error_message must be provided. This is the field UReport uses during the auto analysis process.
To allow a more percise result, field token is recommended. Because a error message might contain dynamic value that varies from execution to execution.

What is token then?
A token is a string field that is totally up to the user to set.
Most commonly, if you are using any testing framework with a programming language, it won't be very hard to generate a string of number based on the line number of the failure from the stack trace.
Such sequential number can be used as your unique token. If the error message contains dynamic value such as date, providing the token will make the auto-analysis more accureate.

Note: UReport does not genreate the token, it is up to the user to provide the value
  • When field token is present, token will be used for auto-analysis
  • When only field error_message is present, error_message will be used for auto-analysis
  • When only field stack_trace is present, stack_trace will be used for auto-analysis
  • The precedence of the fileds is: token > error_message > stack_trace
  • When all three fileds are missing from a fail test, false will be return for all analysis.
FAQ.QUESTION_UID: What is a UID from the test?
FAQ.ANSWER_UID:
UID stands for unique ID. It could be a number or string or the combination of both. The point is to have such unique ID mapped to each of the automated test.
To make the auto anaylsis work, UReport need to have a way to identify the uniqueness of each test, by providing a unique id when sending test run results to the UReport server, it will enable UReport to perform auto-analysis normally.
You will find this UID field everywhere when using API.
If your orgnization is using any testing management tool such as TestRail, PractiTest or HP ALM, you won't have trouble finding a unique number associated with any test you creat. You can use this id to link with your automation run and then send this info to the UReport server.
Even if your orgnization does not use any test management tool, you can still assign some unique string or number to your automated tests. You just need to make sure they don't change after it is decided.
FAQ.QUESTION_D_PL: What is the difference between a bind product lane dashboard and non-bind product lane dashboard?
FAQ.QUESTION_T_INV_ASS_PIN: What is the difference between investigated test, assigned test, and pinned test?
FAQ.ANSWER_T_INV_ASS_PIN:
• An investigated test will be carried to future and past builds, it will be attached to test cases only when the failure reason is the same. Users can set the number of days in the system settings to control how long should the auto-analysis engine search back.
  • An assigned test can be viewed by anyone, and the assignment of the same test will be carried to future runs until it is unassigned. The assignment will not show only when the test is either pass or mark as investigated.
  • A pinned test case can only be viewed by the user who pins it. A pin will always be carried to future builds regardless of the status of the test until it is unpinned by the user.
FAQ.QUESTION_T_INV_OUT: What is the difference between investigated status and outage status?
FAQ.ANSWER_T_INV_OUT:
• An investigated test will be carried to future and past builds, it will be attached to test case only when the failure reason is the same.
  • An outage is only apply to the build it marked at. An outage will NOT be carried to future or past builds.
FAQ.ANSWER_CES:
CES stands for Customize Executable Script.
It allows users to create customizable commands, scripts, or configurations to run any tests to a specific automation framework
FAQ.ANSWER_S_PLS_1:
A product lane setting is a set of configurations for a specific product and automation type combination. Such a setting will only apply to builds or product lanes under the defined product and automation type.
For instance, if there are three product lanes as below:
FAQ.ANSWER_S_PLS_2: And there is a product lane setting bind with product <u>UReport</u> and type <u>UI</u>, such setting will only apply to the builds from the first two product lane, because the third product lane has the automation type <u>API</u>
FAQ.ANSWER_S_IT_1:
An Issue Type is a type of investigated test user can select when test is marked as Investigated or Outage. UReport provide a list of available Issue Type to select from and also support custom Issue Type.
The available Issue Type are:
FAQ.ANSWER_S_IT_2: If no product lane setting is defined, two default Issue Type will be available to select for Mark as Investigated and Mark as Outage. They are <u>Defect</u> and <u>Automation Issue</u>
FAQ.QUESTION_S_RF: What is Test Relation Filter? And what is the group filter?
